snippet: In a statement, prosecutors said they were charging the officer with “battery causing death” in the killing of Ms. Sabbagh, a poet and activist, with a shotgun blast of birdshot.
abstract: Egyptian prosecutors say they are charging a police officer, who remains unnamed, with manslaughter in Jan 24 killing of activist Shaimaa el-Sabbagh during peaceful demonstration in Cairo's Tahrir Square; will also charge some of Sabbagh's fellow protesters with threat to public order.
lead_paragraph: In a statement, prosecutors said they were charging the officer with “battery causing death” in the killing of Ms. Sabbagh, a poet and activist, with a shotgun blast of birdshot.

headline.main: Egypt to Charge Officer in Killing of Shaimaa el-Sabbagh
headline.print_headline: Egypt to Charge Officer in Killing of an Activist
